shorts.title: Community Briefs 11/6/25
shorts.description: Tinnitus expert to speak at support group meeting Dr. Gail Brenner, a board-certified audiologist and founder of the Tinnitus Treatment Center of Philadelphia, will be a guest speaker at the Tinnitus Support Group of Northeast Pennsylvania meeting on Friday at 2 p.m. at the Wright Center for Community Health Mid Valley, 5 S. Washington Ave., Jermyn. Brenner has dedicated over 40 years to helping patients with hearing loss and tinnitus and specializes in Tinnitus Retraining Therapy (TRT), a treatment based on the Neurophysiological Model of Tinnitus developed by Dr. Pawel Jastreboff. Brenner has extensive experience in diagnostic testing, hearing aid […]
shorts.content: Tinnitus expert to speak at support group meeting Dr. Gail Brenner, a board-certified audiologist and founder of the Tinnitus Treatment Center of Philadelphia, will be a guest speaker at the Tinnitus Support Group of Northeast Pennsylvania meeting on Friday at 2 p.m. at the Wright Center for Community Health Mid Valley, 5 S. Washington Ave., Jermyn. Brenner has dedicated over 40 years to helping patients with hearing loss and tinnitus and specializes in Tinnitus Retraining Therapy (TRT), a treatment based on the Neurophysiological Model of Tinnitus developed by Dr. Pawel Jastreboff. Brenner has extensive experience in diagnostic testing, hearing aid […]

shorts.title: School Briefs 11/6/25
shorts.description: Commonwealth University The university honored two local students as 2024-25 Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference (PSAC) Scholar Athletes. Sean Mackinder of Archbald was honored for football at Commonwealth University-Bloomsburg. Courtney Rebar of Throop was recognized for women’s soccer at Commonwealth University-Bloomsburg. Student-athletes must maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.25 upon completion of the academic year to be eligible for the PSAC Scholar-Athlete Award. Commonwealth University-Lock Haven Briana Catanzaro of Dunmore was recognized at the Psychology Department’s Psi Chi Induction ceremony this spring. Catanzaro was also among the fall 2024 inductees. East Stroudsburg University Naomi Springer of Dunmore participated in […]
shorts.content: Commonwealth University The university honored two local students as 2024-25 Pennsylvania State Athletic Conference (PSAC) Scholar Athletes. Sean Mackinder of Archbald was honored for football at Commonwealth University-Bloomsburg. Courtney Rebar of Throop was recognized for women’s soccer at Commonwealth University-Bloomsburg. Student-athletes must maintain a cumulative GPA of at least 3.25 upon completion of the academic year to be eligible for the PSAC Scholar-Athlete Award. Commonwealth University-Lock Haven Briana Catanzaro of Dunmore was recognized at the Psychology Department’s Psi Chi Induction ceremony this spring. Catanzaro was also among the fall 2024 inductees.
